body_html:
I think tensorflow/core/kernels:android_tensorflow_kernels might be enough.
…
On Tue, Jan 2, 2018 at 6:33 PM, Mengwei Xu ***@***.***> wrote: Thanks @cwhipkey <https://github.com/cwhipkey> I think that I didn't include any kernel into the compilation. The current BUILD file is as follows cc_binary( name = "librnn_dict_test", srcs = glob(["utils/*.h"]) + [ "test_rnn.cc", ] + if_android([ "abort_wrapper.cc", "rnn_dict_wrap.cxx", "//tensorflow/core:android_op_registrations_and_gradients", ]), copts = tf_copts() + [ "-fexceptions", "-DSUPPORT_SELECTIVE_REGISTRATION", ], linkopts = ["-lm"] + if_android([ "-pie", "-landroid", "-llog", "-lz", "-z defs", "-Wl,--version-script", LINKER_SCRIPT, "-Wl,--wrap=abort", ]), deps = [ "//xinmei/quantized_graph_loader:quantized_graph_proto_cc", ] + if_android([ ***@***.***//:gemmlowp", "//tensorflow/core:android_tensorflow_lib_selective_registration", LINKER_SCRIPT]), ) What I need to add to make it work? — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#15732 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AQw4wbtsPb01Fxp13UNvNBk9GHvgJhTLks5tGucIgaJpZM4RPmUf> .
body_text:
I think tensorflow/core/kernels:android_tensorflow_kernels might be enough.
…
On Tue, Jan 2, 2018 at 6:33 PM, Mengwei Xu ***@***.***> wrote:
 Thanks @cwhipkey <https://github.com/cwhipkey> I think that I didn't
 include any kernel into the compilation. The current BUILD file is as
 follows

 cc_binary(
     name = "librnn_dict_test",
     srcs = glob(["utils/*.h"])
         + [
             "test_rnn.cc",
         ]
         + if_android([
             "abort_wrapper.cc",
             "rnn_dict_wrap.cxx",
             "//tensorflow/core:android_op_registrations_and_gradients",
           ]),
     copts = tf_copts() + [
             "-fexceptions",
             "-DSUPPORT_SELECTIVE_REGISTRATION",
           ],
     linkopts = ["-lm"] + if_android([
         "-pie",
         "-landroid",
         "-llog",
         "-lz",
         "-z defs",
         "-Wl,--version-script", LINKER_SCRIPT,
         "-Wl,--wrap=abort",
     ]),
     deps = [
             "//xinmei/quantized_graph_loader:quantized_graph_proto_cc",
         ] + if_android([
             ***@***.***//:gemmlowp",
             "//tensorflow/core:android_tensorflow_lib_selective_registration",
             LINKER_SCRIPT]),
 )

 What I need to add to make it work?

 —
 You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#15732 (comment)>,
 or mute the thread
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AQw4wbtsPb01Fxp13UNvNBk9GHvgJhTLks5tGucIgaJpZM4RPmUf>
 .
body:
I think tensorflow/core/kernels:android_tensorflow_kernels might be enough.

On Tue, Jan 2, 2018 at 6:33 PM, Mengwei Xu <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Thanks @cwhipkey <https://github.com/cwhipkey> I think that I didn't
> include any kernel into the compilation. The current BUILD file is as
> follows
>
> cc_binary(
>     name = "librnn_dict_test",
>     srcs = glob(["utils/*.h"])
>         + [
>             "test_rnn.cc",
>         ]
>         + if_android([
>             "abort_wrapper.cc",
>             "rnn_dict_wrap.cxx",
>             "//tensorflow/core:android_op_registrations_and_gradients",
>           ]),
>     copts = tf_copts() + [
>             "-fexceptions",
>             "-DSUPPORT_SELECTIVE_REGISTRATION",
>           ],
>     linkopts = ["-lm"] + if_android([
>         "-pie",
>         "-landroid",
>         "-llog",
>         "-lz",
>         "-z defs",
>         "-Wl,--version-script", LINKER_SCRIPT,
>         "-Wl,--wrap=abort",
>     ]),
>     deps = [
>             "//xinmei/quantized_graph_loader:quantized_graph_proto_cc",
>         ] + if_android([
>             "@gemmlowp//:gemmlowp",
>             "//tensorflow/core:android_tensorflow_lib_selective_registration",
>             LINKER_SCRIPT]),
> )
>
> What I need to add to make it work?
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.

> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/15732#issuecomment-354926061>,
> or mute the thread

> .
